(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Prathamodhyayah) Description of the chief warriors of both the armies and the sound of the conch shell and the sadness of Arjuna who was frightened by the sin of killing his own people.
(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Dwityodhyayah) While encouraging Arjun for war, the Lord explained the status and glory of Sankhyayoga, Karmayoga and Sthitaprajya by analyzing the daily things.

(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Trityodhyayah) Pronunciation of the need to perform one's duty according to all the means like Gyan Yoga and Karma Yoga and the glory of following one's own religion and description of the methods of sexual control.

(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Chaturthodhyayah) Describing the influence of Sagun God, selfless action and conduct of Yogi Mahatma men and their glory, description of various yagyas and glory of knowledge.
(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Panchmodhyayah) Description of Sankhyayoga, Selfless Karmayoga, Gyanyoga and Dhyanayoga including Bhakti.
(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Shasthodhyayah) Inspiration for self-salvation by presenting selfless Karmayoga and description of the dynamics of Dhyanayoga and Yogabhrasht through mental control.

(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Saptamodhyayah) Statement of knowledge-science, omnipresence of God, worship of other Gods and condemnation of those who do not know God and glorification of those who know God.
(Shrimadbhagavadgitayamashtamodhyayah) Arjuna's seven questions and their answers regarding Brahma, spirituality and karma and the presentation of Bhaktiyoga and Shukla and Krishna paths.

Description: Chief science and the Chief mystery
Detailed description: (Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Navamodhyayah) Description of the origin of knowledge, science and the world, the nature of God including the influence of demonic and divine possessions, the glory of selfless worship and devotion to God.
(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Dasmodhyayah) Statement of God's glory and yoga power and Bhaktiyoga along with its effect, Lord's re-description of his glory and yoga power when asked by Arjuna.

(Shrimad Bhagavad Gita Yamekadashodhyayah) Arjuna's prayer for seeing the universal form, description of the universal form by God and Sanjaya, Arjuna seeing the universal form of God, prayer of praise to God by the frightened Arjun, glorification of seeing the universal form and four-armed form by the Lord and statement of attainment of God only through exclusive devotion.

(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Dwadashodhyayah) Judgment of the excellence of the worshipers of the formless and formless and the method of attaining God and description of the characteristics of men who have attained God.
(Srimad Bhagavad Gitayan Trayodshodhyayah) Description of the field-expert and Prakriti-purush along with knowledge.

(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Chaturdashodhyayah) Glory and nature of knowledge - Description of the origin of the world from Purusha, the three gunas of Sattva, Raja, Tam, the means of attaining God and the characteristics of Gunatit Purusha.
(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Panchadashodhyayah) Description of the world tree, the means of attaining God, the soul, the form of God with its effect and the essence of Kshar, Akshar and Purushottam.

(Shrimad Bhagavad Gitayan Shodasodhyayah) Description of divine and demonic wealth along with its results and inspiration to give up conduct contrary to the scriptures and behave in accordance with the scriptures.

(Shrimad Bhagavad Geetayan Saptadashodhyayah) Description of devotion and those who perform severe penance contrary to the scriptures, different types of diet, yagya, penance and charity and explanation of the use of Om, Tat, Sat.

(Shrimadbhagvadgitayamaashtadashodhyayah) Description of renunciation, Sankhya Siddhanta, varna-dharma with its fruits, devotion to knowledge along with worship, selfless karmayoga along with devotion and the greatness of Gita.
